# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts `col` to lower case and removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Then it replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]+"` is used to match one or more whitespace characters or hyphens.
